content:
MobilePage Class

Definition

Serves as the base class for all ASP.NET mobile Web Forms pages. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.Designer("Microsoft.VisualStudio.Web.WebForms.MobileWebFormDesigner, Microsoft.VisualStudio.Web, Version=10.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a", typeof(System.ComponentModel.Design.IRootDesigner))]
[System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItem(false)]
[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
public class MobilePage : System.Web.UI.Page

Remarks

The MobilePage class inherits from the ASP.NET Page class. To specify a mobile page and use ASP.NET mobile controls, an ASP.NET mobile Web Forms page must contain the following page directive. 

<%@ Page   
  Inherits="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage" Language="c#" %>

The Inherits attribute is required. The Language attribute is set to the language that is used on the page, if it is needed.

Note

ASP.NET mobile pages allow for multiple mobile forms on each page, whereas ASP.NET Web pages allow for only one form per page.

Constructors

MobilePage()

Creates an instance of the MobilePage class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public MobilePage ();

Fields

HiddenPostEventArgumentId

Contains the identifier to use for the hidden field in the postback argument. This field is read-only. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public static readonly string HiddenPostEventArgumentId;

Remarks

Adapters use this field to render postbacks.

HiddenPostEventSourceId

Contains the source identifier to use to render the hidden field for the postback source. This field is read-only. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public static readonly string HiddenPostEventSourceId;

Remarks

Adapters use this field to render postbacks.

HiddenVariablePrefix

Returns the prefix to use to render hidden variables. This field is read-only. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public static readonly string HiddenVariablePrefix;

PageClientViewStateKey

Returns the key to use to render the private view state. This field is read-only. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public static readonly string PageClientViewStateKey;

Remarks

This field is used by adapters to render private view state. For more information, see the ASP.NET State Management Overview documentation.

ViewStateID

Contains the source identifier to use to render the hidden field for a view state. This field is read-only. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public static readonly string ViewStateID;

Remarks

This field is used by adapters to render view-state information. For more information, see the ASP.NET State Management Overview documentation.

Properties

AbsoluteFilePath

Gets a rooted URL to the current page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public string AbsoluteFilePath { get; }
Value
String

A rooted URL to the current page.

Remarks

A rooted URL is absolute with regard to the server, but it is not a complete URL because it does not include the protocol prefix or server name.

ActiveForm

Gets or sets the page's currently active form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form ActiveForm { get; set; }
Value
Form

The page's currently active form.

Exceptions
Exception

The page does not contain any forms.

Remarks

When a page is initially rendered, the first form in the page is automatically made active. On subsequent postbacks, another form might be made active, either by programmatically setting this property, or as a result of user navigation through a Link control.

Adapter

Gets the device-specific adapter for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IPageAdapter Adapter { get; }
Value
IPageAdapter

The device-specific adapter for the control.

AllowCustomAttributes

Gets a value indicating whether controls on the page can have custom attributes defined. The default value is the value of the allowCustomAttributes attribute of the <mobilecontrols> section of the Web.config file. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public bool AllowCustomAttributes { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the controls on the page can have custom attributes defined; otherwise, false.

Remarks

In addition to the IAttributeAccessor interface, the ASP.NET page framework provides a CustomAttributes dictionary that allows you to specify additional attributes, enable or disable custom attributing, or adjust a control's behavior or rendering. To enable or disable custom attributing, you can either set the AllowCustomAttributes property to true, or you can set the allowCustomAttributes attribute of the <mobileControls> section of Web.config to true.

Note

When custom attributes are enabled, typographic errors in property names can be interpreted as custom attributes. For example, if a developer incorrectly specifies the Text property of a control as "Txet", the parser would save it as a custom attribute called "Txet" instead of raising an exception. For this reason, custom attributes are disabled by default.

ClientViewState

Gets the view-state information, which combines private view state and an identifier for application view state, to write to the client in encoded form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public string ClientViewState { get; }
Value
String

The view-state information, which combines private view state and an identifier for application view state.

DesignMode

Gets a value indicating whether the page is being instantiated in design mode or at run time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public bool DesignMode { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the page is being instantiated in design mode; otherwise, false.

Device

Gets the MobileCapabilities object for the current requesting device. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities Device { get; }
Value
MobileCapabilities

The MobileCapabilities for the current requesting device.

Remarks

This property is provided for convenience, and is equivalent to obtaining browser information from the HttpRequest object, such as Page.Request.Browser.

EnableEventValidation

Gets or sets a value indicating whether postback event data should be validated. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override bool EnableEventValidation { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

false.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

An attempt was made to set this property.

Remarks

ASP.NET controls create client-side scripts to raise postback events on the server. It is possible for a malicious user to use the postback script to send arbitrary post events to server controls. For this reason, ASP.NET version 2.0 controls validate the event data to ensure that the event was raised by client-side code rendered by the control.

Event validation is not supported in mobile pages.

EnableTheming

Gets or sets a value indicating whether themes apply to this page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override bool EnableTheming { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

false.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

An attempt was made to set this property. The value of this property cannot be changed.

Remarks

Themes are not supported on mobile pages.

Forms

Gets the collection of forms on the specified MobilePage object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Collections.IList Forms { get; }
Value
IList

The collection of forms that is contained in the page.

HiddenVariables

Gets a dictionary of hidden variables on the specified MobilePage object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Collections.IDictionary HiddenVariables { get; }
Value
IDictionary

A dictionary of the hidden variables that is contained in the page.

IdSeparator

Gets the character that is used to separate control identifiers when building a unique ID for a control on a page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override char IdSeparator { get; }
Value
Char

The character that is used to separate control identifiers. The default is set by the PageAdapter instance that renders the page. The stem.Web.UI.Page.IdSeparator* property is a server-side field and should not be modified.

Remarks

This member overrides IdSeparator to return a colon (:) if the adapter is a WmlPageAdapter or XhtmlPageAdapter. Otherwise, it returns the default character.

MasterPageFile

Gets or sets the file name of the master page. Master pages are not supported in ASP.NET mobile Web Forms pages. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override sealed string MasterPageFile { get; set; }
Value
String

null.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

An attempt was made to set this property. Master pages are not supported on mobile pages.

Remarks

This member overrides MasterPageFile to prevent master pages from being used. This is because master pages are not supported on ASP.NET mobile Web Forms pages.

QueryStringText

Gets the query string that accompanied the request. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public string QueryStringText { get; }
Value
String

The query string that accompanied the request.

Remarks

The property returns any characters in the request that follow the question mark (?) in the URL. This value can be different from the ServerVariables property. For devices where a unique file path suffix is inserted into a URL for postback, this property automatically strips out the file path suffix. For example, if the original query is "/home.aspx?id=john+doe", the value of the QueryStringText property will be "id=john+doe". A following postback URL could be "/home.aspx?_ufps=20292303920&id=john+doe". On this last postback, the value of the QueryStringText property will again be "id=john+doe", because the unique suffix will be stripped out.

Caution

If the key portion of the key/value pair stored in the QueryStringText property is the same as the ID property of a control on the MobilePage object, the view state and the key/value pair are removed from the QueryStringText property.

RelativeFilePath

Gets a relative URL to the page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public string RelativeFilePath { get; }
Value
String

A relative URL to the page.

StyleSheet

Gets or sets the current style sheet on a MobilePage object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet StyleSheet { get; set; }
Value
StyleSheet

The current style sheet for the page.

Remarks

A mobile page can have only one style sheet.

StyleSheetTheme

Gets or sets the name of the style sheet applied to this page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override string StyleSheetTheme { get; set; }
Value
String

null.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

An attempt was made to set this property. Themes are not supported on Mobile Web Forms pages.

Remarks

This member overrides StyleSheetTheme to prevent themes from being changed from the default. This is because themes are not supported on ASP.NET Mobile Web Forms pages.

Theme

Gets or sets the name of the page theme. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override string Theme { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the page theme. The Theme property is a server-side field and cannot be modified.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

An attempt was made to set this property. Themes are not supported on Mobile Web Forms pages.

Remarks

This member overrides Theme to prevent themes from being enabled. This is because themes are not supported on ASP.NET mobile Web Forms pages.

Title

Gets or sets the title for the page. This feature is not supported for mobile pages. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public string Title { get; set; }
Value
String

An empty string.

Exceptions
NotSupportedException

An attempt was made to set the Title property.

UniqueFilePathSuffix

Gets a unique key that can be added to generate a unique URL for the current page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public string UniqueFilePathSuffix { get; }
Value
String

A unique key that can be added to generate a unique URL for the current page.

Remarks

Some mobile browsers require a unique URL to work correctly.

Methods

AddedControl(Control,Int32)

Called after a control is added to the stem.Web.UI.Control.Controls* collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void AddedControl (System.Web.UI.Control control, int index);
control
Control

The MobileControl that has been added.

index
Int32

The index of the control in the Controls collection.

Remarks

This member overrides the AddedControl method to determine whether the control is a Form or a UserControl before it calls the base method. If the control is a Form or a UserControl object, the Forms property is set to null.

AddParsedSubObject(Object)

Notifies the page that an element was parsed, and adds the element to the stem.Web.UI.Control.Controls* property. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void AddParsedSubObject (object o);
o
Object

An Object that represents the parsed element.

Exceptions
Exception

The stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.StyleSheet* property has already been set.

Remarks

Unless you override it, this method automatically adds LiteralControl objects to the server control's ControlCollection object. This collection can be accessed through the Controls property.

This member overrides the AddParsedSubObject method to determine whether the object is a StyleSheet before it calls the base method. If the object is of type StyleSheet, the StyleSheet property is set to the o parameter.

CreateHtmlTextWriter(TextWriter)

Creates an HtmlTextWriter object to render the page's content. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter CreateHtmlTextWriter (System.IO.TextWriter writer);
writer
TextWriter

The TextWriter used to create the HtmlTextWriter.

Returns
HtmlTextWriter

An HtmlTextWriter or a text writer derived from HtmlTextWriter, such as

HtmlMobileTextWriter, WmlMobileTextWriter, ChtmlMobileTextWriter, or XhtmlMobileTextWriter.

Remarks

The type of writer created is determined by the adapter associated with the current mobile device. For more information about how to map adapters to devices, see Adapter Mappings.

DeterminePostBackMode()

Determines the type of request made for the MobilePage class and returns a NameValueCollection of data posted back to the page by using either a POST or a GET command. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection DeterminePostBackMode ();
Returns
NameValueCollection

A NameValueCollection object that contains the form data.

Remarks

This member overrides the DeterminePostBackMode method to determine whether the page was requested because of a transfer or a redirect. If so, null is returned. Otherwise, the DeterminePostBackMode method of the adapter is called.

GetControlAdapter(MobileControl)

Creates and returns a new device-specific adapter for the specified control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IControlAdapter GetControlAdapter (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl control);
control
MobileControl

The control to which the device-specific adapter is attached.

Returns
IControlAdapter

A new device-specific adapter for the specified control.

Remarks

This method is called internally by ASP.NET.

GetForm(String)

Returns the form object specified by the ID parameter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form GetForm (string id);
id
String

The identifier of the form to return.

Returns
Form

The specified form object. If no such form exists, GetForm throws an exception.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The requested form was not found.

Remarks

Each form has a string identification number associated with it. When you supply the ID of a form on the page, this method returns the corresponding Form object.

GetPrivateViewState(MobileControl)

Retrieves the view state for the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public object GetPrivateViewState (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl ctl);
ctl
MobileControl

The control for which the state is retrieved.

Returns
Object

The StateBag object associated with the control.

Remarks

A control's view state is the aggregation of all its non-default property values.

HasHiddenVariables()

Retrieves whether the page has any hidden variables defined. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public bool HasHiddenVariables ();
Returns
Boolean

true if the page has any hidden variables defined; otherwise, false.

InitOutputCache(Int32,String,String,OutputCacheLocation,String)

Initializes the output cache for the current page request. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void InitOutputCache (int duration, string varyByHeader, string varyByCustom, System.Web.UI.OutputCacheLocation location, string varyByParam);
duration
Int32

The amount of time that objects stored in the output cache are valid.

varyByHeader
String

A semicolon-separated list of headers that content from the output cache will vary by.

varyByCustom
String

The Vary HTTP header.

location
OutputCacheLocation

One of the OutputCacheLocation values.

varyByParam
String

A semicolon-separated list of parameters, received by a GET or POST method, that content from the output cache will vary by.

Remarks

This member overrides the InitOutputCache method to add more VaryByHeader keywords to provide correct caching of page output for different markup devices.

InitOutputCache(Int32,String,String,String,OutputCacheLocation,String)

Initializes the output cache for the current page request. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void InitOutputCache (int duration, string varyByContentEncoding, string varyByHeader, string varyByCustom, System.Web.UI.OutputCacheLocation location, string varyByParam);
duration
Int32

The amount of time that objects stored in the output cache are valid.

varyByContentEncoding
String

A semicolon-separated list of character-sets (content encodings) that content from the output cache will vary by.

varyByHeader
String

A semicolon-separated list of headers that content from the output cache will vary by.

varyByCustom
String

The Vary HTTP header.

location
OutputCacheLocation

One of the OutputCacheLocation values.

varyByParam
String

A semicolon-separated list of parameters, received by a GET or POST method, that content from the output cache will vary by.

Remarks

This member overrides the InitOutputCache method to add more VaryByHeader keywords to provide correct caching of page output for different markup devices.

LoadPageStateFromPersistenceMedium()

Loads any saved view-state information to the Page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override object LoadPageStateFromPersistenceMedium ();
Returns
Object

An object containing the saved view state. Internally, this is typically a StateBag or IDictionary object.

Remarks

This member overrides the LoadPageStateFromPersistenceMedium method and optimizes the state data for mobile devices.

LoadViewState(Object)

Restores view-state information from a previous page request that was saved by the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage.SaveViewState* method. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void LoadViewState (object savedState);
savedState
Object

An Object that represents the page state to be restored.

Remarks

This method is primarily used by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code. However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state. For more information, see ASP.NET State Management Overview.

This member overrides the LoadViewState method and saves any existing adapter state with the view state in an object array.

MakePathAbsolute(String)

Converts the specified relative URL into an absolute URL. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public string MakePathAbsolute (string virtualPath);
virtualPath
String

The relative URL to be converted.

Returns
String

The absolute path corresponding to the specified virtual path.

Remarks

Absolute URLs differ depending on whether the application is configured for cookieless session management. This method provides a single way to translate application URLs regardless of the cookie setting.

OnDeviceCustomize(EventArgs)

Called after the page is initialized. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void OnDeviceCustomize (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An object defined by an EventArgs object that contains event data.

Remarks

You can override this method to set device-specific properties. If you override this method in an inheriting class, you must call the base implementation.

OnError(EventArgs)

Handles the Error event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void OnError (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs object that contains the event data.

Remarks

This method overrides the OnError method to allow the adapter to handle the error.

OnInit(EventArgs)

Handles the Init event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void OnInit (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs object that contains the event data.

Remarks

This method overrides the OnInit method to customize the event data for the adapter.

OnLoad(EventArgs)

Handles the Load event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void OnLoad (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs object that contains the event data.

Remarks

This method overrides the OnLoad method to customize the event data for the adapter.

OnPreInit(EventArgs)

Raises the PreInit event at the beginning of page initialization. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void OnPreInit (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs object that contains the event data.

Remarks

This method overrides the OnPreInit method to customize the event data for the adapter.

OnPreRender(EventArgs)

Handles the PreRender event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void OnPreRender (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs object that contains the event data.

Remarks

This method overrides the OnPreRenderComplete method to customize the event data for the adapter.

OnUnload(EventArgs)

Handles the Unload event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void OnUnload (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs object that contains the event data.

Remarks

This method overrides the OnUnload method to customize the event data for the adapter.

OnViewStateExpire(EventArgs)

Handles an exception caused by an expired view state on postback. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void OnViewStateExpire (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An object defined by an EventArgs object that contains event data.

Exceptions
Exception

The session state has expired.

-or-

The session cookie from the client is invalid.

-or-

The session state history has exceeded its allocated size.

Remarks

If you expect to restore a page from a view state, and the page's underlying session has expired, this method's default implementation raises an exception. You can override this method, perform custom handling to restore the page state without relying on view state, and return without calling the base implementation.

RaisePostBackEvent(IPostBackEventHandler,String)

Notifies the server control that caused the postback that it should handle an incoming postback event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void RaisePostBackEvent (System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler sourceControl, string eventArgument);
sourceControl
IPostBackEventHandler

The ASP.NET server control that caused the postback. This control must implement the IPostBackEventHandler interface.

eventArgument
String

The postback argument.

Remarks

This member overrides the RaisePostBackEvent method to determine whether the control is a Form. In that case, the method attempts to locate and call the default event handler from the active mobile Web Form. Otherwise, the base method is called.

RedirectToMobilePage(String)

Redirects to another mobile page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void RedirectToMobilePage (string url);
url
String

The URL of the redirect action.

RedirectToMobilePage(String,Boolean)

Redirects to a specified mobile page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void RedirectToMobilePage (string url, bool endResponse);
url
String

The URL of the redirect action.

endResponse
Boolean

Specifies whether the response should be ended at that point. The default of the first form of the method is true.

RemovedControl(Control)

Called after a control is removed from the stem.Web.UI.Control.Controls* collection of another control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void RemovedControl (System.Web.UI.Control control);
control
Control

The MobileControl that has been removed.

Remarks

This member overrides the RemovedControl method to determine whether the control is a Form or a UserControl before calling the base method. If the control is a Form or a UserControl, the Forms property is set to null.

Render(HtmlTextWriter)

Sends server control content to a provided HtmlTextWriter object, which writes the content to be rendered on the client. Also stores tracing information about the control if tracing is enabled. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void Render (System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer);
writer
HtmlTextWriter

The text writer that creates the markup.

Remarks

This member overrides the Render method to call the Render method of the control adapter.

RenderControl(HtmlTextWriter)

Renders server control content and stores tracing information about the control if tracing is enabled. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void RenderControl (System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer);
writer
HtmlTextWriter

The TextWriter to receive control content.

Remarks

This member overrides the RenderControl method to call the RenderControl method of the default control adapter.

SavePageStateToPersistenceMedium(Object)

Saves any state information for the page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void SavePageStateToPersistenceMedium (object view);
view
Object

An Object in which to store the view-state information.

Exceptions
Exception

Session state is disabled or read-only.

Remarks

This member overrides the SavePageStateToPersistenceMedium method to optimize the state data.

SaveViewState()

Saves any server control view-state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override object SaveViewState ();
Returns
Object

The page's current view state.

Remarks

This member overrides the SaveViewState method to save any existing adapter state with view state in an object array. If there is no view state associated with the control, this method returns null.

Validate()

Performs control validation, and then sets the stem.Web.UI.Page.IsValid* property based on the results of the validation. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void Validate ();

VerifyRenderingInServerForm(Control)

Confirms that a Form control is rendered for the specified ASP.NET mobile control at run time. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void VerifyRenderingInServerForm (System.Web.UI.Control control);
control
Control

The ASP.NET mobile control that is required in the Form control.

Exceptions
Exception

control must be contained in a Form control.

Remarks

This method overrides the VerifyRenderingInServerForm method to throw an exception if the control is not in a Form at run time.
